name: The Homeland of Pure Joy by William Dewey
description:
On a misty morning in Wellington, New Zealand, actor and expat Parker Flynn sees a ghost from a past life. The vision unleashes a torrent of memories about his first love from his days at university in the United States, and Parker is shocked at the power of the emotions those memories evoke. In a misadventure that could prove disastrous or enlightening, Parker attempts to reconcile his feelings for people and places in his past with the vivid opportunities of the present.

Paperback
(5.25" x 8", 199 pages)

Comes with a mini-comic (inspired by the book) by Chris Sabatini

name: The Homeland of Pure Joy EBOOK by William Dewey
description:
Even more transportable than the paperback, the HOMELAND OF PURE JOY eBook can be loaded onto your favorite device and read almost anywhere!

Description:
On a misty morning in Wellington, New Zealand, actor and expat Parker Flynn sees a ghost from a past life. The vision unleashes a torrent of memories about first love from his days at university in the United States, and Parker is shocked at the power of the emotions those memories evoke. Amending his original plans for the day, Parker begins a trek to find this woman and confirm her identity, and to understand her place in his life, if there is one. In a misadventure that could prove disastrous or enlightening, William Deweyâ€™s The Homeland of Pure Joy follows Parker as he attempts to reconcile his feelings for people and places in his past with the vivid opportunities of the present.

Currently available in EPUB and MOBI formats. We are happy to try to accommodate additional formats - please contact us at info@maybeparade.com to inquire about other options.

name: The Homeland of Pure Joy DIGIBOUND (book combo)
description:
For those who still love the feel of turning real pages but also appreciate the extra portability presented by "electronic books" (ebooks), your purchase of a bound version of THE HOMELAND OF PURE JOY now comes with a free download of the ebook.

Description:
On a misty morning in Wellington, New Zealand, actor and expat Parker Flynn sees a ghost from a past life. The vision unleashes a torrent of memories about his first love from his days at university in the United States, and Parker is shocked at the power of the emotions those memories evoke. In a misadventure that could prove disastrous or enlightening, Parker attempts to reconcile his feelings for people and places in his past with the vivid opportunities of the present.

Paperback
(5.25" x 8", 199 pages)

Ebook
(available in EPUB & MOBI formats; please contact us at info@maybeparade.com to inquire about additional formats)

Comes with a mini-comic (inspired by the book) by Chris Sabatini

name: Without a Soul to Move by William Dewey
description:
In Denver, CO, three men try with strange elegance to extract meaning from their wilting lives. Howie struggles with the demise of a love that was never quite whole to begin with, Wayne attempts to create a world defined by his absence, and Adam plots a quixotic war against suffering itself. Their efforts are marked by varying degrees of sanity, all coalescing as the winter confines of a snowbound Denver close in around them.

Paperback
(5.5" x 8.5", 254 pages)

A guest publication from the Lawrence & Gibson Publishing Collective (New Zealand)

name: Subscription to Eight & a Half by Eleven Comics by Chris Sabatini
description:
Eight and a Half by Eleven is a comic pamphlet which fills both sides of a piece of heavyweight vellum cardstock, and which can be delivered to you in a sturdy brown envelope by an agent of the federal government for a cost of $1 per issue.  New issues are released on a semi-monthly basis.

Use the quantity field to indicate how many issues you would care to receive, and your subscription will start with the most current issue.  We will commit to continuing the comic for at least as long as subscriptions are pending.  But probably it will go on forever regardless.

Back issues can be had at a rate of 3 for $1; please indicate in the order notes which of your dollars you want to go toward which back issues.

(8.5" x 11", 1 page, double-sided)

name: Proper Procedures for Press Pot Brew by Chris Sabatini
description:
A how-to comic for the uninitiated - step-by-step instructions for brewing the perfect pot of french press coffee. Snarky and offensive.

(4" x 5.25", 8 pages)

name: Title by C. Sabatini
description:
A chapbook of poetry honoring the first twelve boxers to win the heavyweight title. 

Hand-bound by author with linoleum block illustrations
(5" x 6.75", 25 pages)
